title: The Poisoner's Handbook
description:
A complete handbook of poisons and how to use them
Topics covered include:

    Plant Poisons: Making ricin from castor beans  Making abrin from precatory beans  The nut of the tung-oil tree  Deadly alkaloids from tobacco, yew, and wolfbane  Potato sprouts  Hemlock  Poisonous mushrooms
    
Animal Toxins:  Poisonous snakes  Spiders and scorpions  Tetrodoxin from fish  Poison frogs  Botulism

    Chemical Poisons:  Arsenic, antimony, and cyanide  White phosphorous  Mercury, iodine, barium, cadmium, and fluoride  How to kill using commonly available anti-freeze

    Terrible Poisons:  The two most terrible poisons known - the horrible and painful deaths they cause

    Poisonous Gases:  Prussic acid  Hydrogen sulfide  Phosgene and phosphine  Arsine  Carbon monoxide

    Lethal Drugs
    Poisonous Explosive Compounds
    Antidotes
    And much, much more, including sources, and notes on chemistry.


One of the most gruesome books ever printed, The Poisoner's Handbook belongs on everybody's bloody murder bookshelf.
